primary.comment: The primary color makes up a large part of the theme, it is used in buttons for example.

primary-darker.comment: The primary darker color is for hover states mainly.

secondary.comment: The secondary color compliments the primary color and serves as the default for text-links.

secondary-darker.comment: The secondary darker color is for hover states mainly.

accent.comment: The accent color is usually the main identity color for a municipality

info.comment: The dark blue text color for informational states and/or messages.

info-light.comment: The light blue background color for informational states and/or messages.

success.comment: The dark green text color for success states and/or messages.

success-light.comment: The light green background color for success states and/or messages.

warning.comment: The dark orange text color for warning states and/or messages.

warning-light.comment: The light orange background color for warning states and/or messages.

danger.comment: The dark red text color for error/critical states and/or messages.

danger-light.comment: The light red background color for error/critical states and/or messages.

danger-lighter.comment: The lighter orange text color for warning states and/or messages.

danger-lightest.comment: The very lightest orange background-color for warning states and/or messages.

bg.comment: Background color for the (main) user interface.

fg.comment: Blackish foreground color for the (main) user interface.

fg-muted.comment: Font/foreground gray ยง1color for non-actionable or less-important content.

fg-heading.comment: Black foreground color for fully black elements.

red-notification.comment: The bright red color for notification badges and texts.
